Learning Objectives
Identify common technological and organizational measures for cybersecurity (focus: detection concepts and organizational relationships); Explain and give examples of the roles of best practices and standards in the design and implementation of such security measures; Explain the functional and organizational advantages and disadvantages of these measures, including impacts from their interaction; Assess the limitations of these security measures in the contexts of organizational change and dynamic threats, flawed technology, and flawed organizational policies and practices; Translate lessons learned from incidents into recommendations for cybersecurity planning and preparedness for better detection.
